meanings.definition: To touch or lean on something
meanings.sent1: The fence will abut the wall of the house.
meanings.sent2: The tree abuts the edge of the garden.
meanings.sent3: The cat loves to abut against the warm fireplace.
meanings.sent4: His ideas abut against the traditional beliefs of the community.
meanings.sent5: The feeling of loneliness abuts against the comfort of solitude.

meanings.definition: To be adjacent to something, especially land or a building
meanings.sent1: The park abuts the school playground.
meanings.sent3: The two houses seem to abut like old friends.
meanings.sent4: Their differences abut like two puzzle pieces fitting perfectly together.
meanings.sent5: The river abuts the bustling city, creating a peaceful contrast.
